summary.para: Performs an equality comparison between the font face object on which Equals is being called and the font face object passed as a parameter.

param.name: fontFace
param.para: A pointer to a font face object to compare with the font face object on which Equals is being called.

returns.para: true if the font face objects are equal. Otherwise, false.

summary.para: Retrieves the number of axes defined by the font face. This includes both static and variable axes (see ).

returns.para: The number of axes defined by the font face.

summary.para: Retrieves the list of axis values used by the font.

param.name: fontAxisValues
param.para: A pointer to an array of DWRITE_FONT_AXIS_VALUE structures into which GetFontAxisValues writes the list of font axis values. You're responsible for managing the size and the lifetime of this array. Call to determine the size of array to allocate.

param.name: fontAxisValueCount
param.para: The maximum number of font axis values to write into the memory block pointed to by fontAxisValues.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.
|Return value|Description| |-|-| |E_INVALIDARG|fontAxisValueCount doesn't match the value returned by GetFontAxisValueCount.|

remarks.para: The values are returned in the canonical order defined by the font, clamped to the actual range supported. It's not necessarily the same axis value array that you passed to CreateFontFace.

summary.para: Retrieves the underlying font resource for this font face. You can use that to query information about the resource, or to recreate a new font face instance with different axis values.

param.name: fontResource
param.para: The address of a pointer to an interface. On successful completion, the function sets the pointer to a newly created font resource object.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.

summary.para: Determines whether this font face's resource supports any variable axes. When true, at least one in the font resource has a non-empty range (maxValue > minValue).

returns.para: true if the font face's resource supports any variable axes. Otherwise, false.

summary.para: Represents an absolute reference to a font face. This interface contains font face type, appropriate file references, and face identification data. It adds new facilities such as comparing two font faces, retrieving font axis values, and retrieving the underlying font resource.
This interface extends . Various font data such as metrics, names, and glyph outlines are obtained from IDWriteFontFace.
